title: Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve: Maps
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Directions & Transportation     Maps              Maps           Wherever you go in south Louisiana, there's a Jean Lafitte site down the road or up the bayou.    The six sites of Jean Lafitte National Historical Park and Preserve are scattered through south Louisiana, from the bayous to the prairies. See the big picture above; information about each site is below.  Here are quick links to transportation options and to information about hours and days that park sites are open. The park's six sites are   Acadian Cultural Center - 501 Fisher Road, Lafayette; 337-232-0789. Map and information   Barataria Preserve - 6588 Barataria Boulevard, Marrero; 504-689-3690 ext. 10. Map and information including trail maps. If you use a GPS system, we recommend that you doublecheck with the map since not all systems find the preserve successfully.   Chalmette Battlefield and Chalmette National Cemetery - 8606 West St. Bernard Highway, Chalmette; 504-281-0510. Map and information   French Quarter Visitor Center - 419 Decatur Street, New Orleans; 504-589-2636 ext. 1. Map and information   Prairie Acadian Cultural Center - 250 West Park Avenue, Eunice; 337-457-8499. Map and information   Wetlands Acadian Cultural Center - 314 St. Mary Street, Thibodaux; 985-448-1375. Map and information   Park headquarters - 419 Decatur Street, New Orleans (upstairs from the French Quarter Visitor Center in New Orleans); 504-589-3882.
